org.ingatan.image
Class ImageEditorController

java.lang.Object
  org.ingatan.image.ImageEditorController

public class ImageEditorController
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the controller for the ImageEditor. It ties together the following components:

  • The ImageToolbar.
  • The EditorColourPane.
  • The ToolOptionPanes.
This class looks at the current state of these components, for example the current colour, the current tool selection, etc., and then responds to user interaction accordingly.
For example; if the user has selected the line tool and clicks and drags across the canvas, the controller will pass the canvas' BufferedImage graphics object to the ImageUtilities class's drawLine method, along with the selected colour,= and the selected line options.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham

ImageEditorController

public ImageEditorController(ImageEditorPane editorPane,
                             EditorCanvas canvas,
                             ImageToolbar toolbar,
                             ColourSwatchPane colourPane)
Create a new instance of ImageEditorController.

Parameters:
editorPane - the ImageEditorPane being controlled.
canvas - the EditorCanvas being controlled.
toolbar - the ImageToolbar being controlled.
colourPane - the ColourSwatchPane being controlled.
Method Detail

selectionLostFocus

public void selectionLostFocus(boolean delete)
Disposes of the current selection. By specifying delete to true, the selection will simply be removed, unless the selection has not yet been dragged, in which case the selection will be filled with the background colour. If the delete field is passed as false, then the selection image will be merged with the underlying canvas image.

Parameters:
delete - whether or not to delete the image.

selectAll

public void selectAll()
Merges the any current selection, and creates a new selection consisting of the entire canvas.

setScaleToolSelected

public void setScaleToolSelected(boolean selected)
Set or unset the scaleToolSelected flag - this flag allows the controller to know whether the rotate tool or scale tool is selected over the top of a selection tool. This method sets scaleToolSelected = selected, and rotateToolSelected = !selected;

Parameters:
selected -

setRotateToolSelected

public void setRotateToolSelected(boolean selected)
Set or unset the rotateToolSelected flag - this flag allows the controller to know whether the rotate tool or scale tool is selected over the top of a selection tool. This method sets rotateToolSelected = selected, and scaleToolSelected = !selected;

Parameters:
selected -

isScaleToolSelected

public boolean isScaleToolSelected()
Checks whether the scaleToolSelected flag is set or not, this allows the controller to tell whether it is the scale tool or rotate tool that is selected over the top of the selection tool.

Returns:
whether or not the scaleToolSelected is selected.

isRotateToolSelected

public boolean isRotateToolSelected()
Checks whether the rotateToolSelected flag is set or not, this allows the controller to tell whether it is the scale tool or rotate tool that is selected over the top of the selection tool.

Returns:
whether or not the rotateToolSelected is selected.

crop

public void crop()
Crop the image around the current selection. If there is no selection, then ignore.

resizeCanvas

public void resizeCanvas(int width,
                         int height)
Resize the canvas to the specified dimension (x,y). The EditorCanvass setPreferredSize method has been overriden to take care of the resizing of BufferedImages and the like. Any size outside the range [10,2000] will be set to either 10 or 2000, depending on which bound it exceeds.

Parameters:
width - the new width of the image.
height - the new height of the image.

flipHorizontally

public void flipHorizontally()
Flip the current selection horizontally, or, if no current selection exists, flip the entire image horizontally.

flipVertically

public void flipVertically()
Flip the current selection vertically, or, if no current selection exists, flip the entire image vertically.

public void previewBrightnessAndContrast(double brightnessOffset,
                                         double contrastScale)

setBrightnessAndContrast

public void setBrightnessAndContrast(double brightnessOffset,
                                     double contrastScale)

updateSelectionTransparencyProperty

public void updateSelectionTransparencyProperty()
If the selection transparency property has been changed, i.e. whether or not to paint the current background colour as transparent, then the current selection sub-image must be altered correspondingly.

paste

public void paste()
Merges any current selection down, and pastes any image data from the clipboard as a new selection in the top left corner.

setCurrentSelection

public void setCurrentSelection(java.awt.image.BufferedImage newSelection,
                                int x,
                                int y)
Set the specified BufferedImage as a new floating selection. Any old selection will be merged down first. The selection will be positioned at the specified coordinate (x,y).

Parameters:
newSelection - the BufferedImage to be used as the new selection.
x - the x coordinate at which to position the selection.
y - the y coordinate at which to position the selection.

copy

public void copy()
Copies the current selection to the clipboard, if there is a current selection.

cut

public void cut()
This is a convenience method which simply calls the copy method of this class, and then deletes the current selection.

createSelectionHandles

public java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D[] createSelectionHandles()
Creates 8 handles for the current selection as an area. This means that area.contains(point) can be used to determine whether or not the mouse is interacting with a handle. The handles will be drawn onto every selection until the destroySelectionHandles() method is called.

Returns:
an array of Ellipse2D shapes which can be used to determine which handle was clicked, etc. the array holds the handles in the following order: NW, N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W.

destroySelectionHandles

public void destroySelectionHandles()
No longer use the selection handles.

paintCurrentSelection

public void paintCurrentSelection()
Painting code for any current selection and selection handles
